org.apache.drill.test

Class BaseDirTestWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.TestWatcher
      • org.apache.drill.test.DirTestWatcher
        • org.apache.drill.test.BaseDirTestWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    public class BaseDirTestWatcher
extends DirTestWatcher

    Overview

    This is a DirTestWatcher which creates all the temporary directories required by a Drillbit and the various dfs.* storage workspaces. It also provides convenience methods that do the following:

    1. Copy project files to temp directories. This is useful for copying the sample data into a temp directory.
    2. Copy resource files to temp.
    3. Updating parquet metadata files.

    The BaseDirTestWatcher creates the following directories in the base temp directory (for a description of where the base temp directory is located please read the docs for DirTestWatcher):

    • tmp: getTmpDir()
    • store: getStoreDir()
    • root: getRootDir()
    • dfsTestTmp: getDfsTestTmpDir()

    Examples

    The BaseDirTestWatcher is used in BaseTestQuery and an example of how it is used in conjunction with the ClusterFixture can be found in ExampleTest.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BaseDirTestWatcher.DirType
      An enum used to represent the directories mapped to the dfs.root and dfs.tmp workspaces repectively.

        public BaseDirTestWatcher(boolean deleteDirAtEnd)
        Creates a BaseDirTestWatcher.
        Parameters:
        deleteDirAtEnd - If true, temp directories are deleted at the end of tests. If false, temp directories are not deleted at the end of tests.

      • copyResourceToRoot

        public File copyResourceToRoot(Path relPath)
        This copies a file or directory from src/test/resources into the temp root directory (corresponding to dfs.root). The relative path of the file or directory in src/test/resources is preserved in the temp root directory.
        Parameters:
        relPath - The relative path of the file or directory in src/test/resources to copy into the root temp folder.
        Returns:
        The File corresponding to the copied file or directory in the temp root directory.

      • copyFileToRoot

        public File copyFileToRoot(Path relPath)
        This copies a filed or directory from the maven project into the temp root directory (corresponding to dfs.root). The relative path of the file or directory in the maven module is preserved in the temp root directory.
        Parameters:
        relPath - The relative path of the file or directory in the maven module to copy into the root temp folder.
        Returns:
        The File corresponding to the copied file or directory in the temp root directory.

      • copyResourceToRoot

        public File copyResourceToRoot(Path relPath,
                               Path destPath)
        This copies a file or directory from src/test/resources into the temp root directory (corresponding to dfs.root). The file or directory is copied to the provided relative destPath in the temp root directory.
        Parameters:
        relPath - The source relative path of a file or directory from src/test/resources that will be copied.
        destPath - The destination relative path of the file or directory in the temp root directory.
        Returns:
        The File corresponding to the final copied file or directory in the temp root directory.

      • removeFileFromRoot

        public void removeFileFromRoot(Path relPath)
                        throws IOException
        Removes a file or directory copied at relativePath inside the root directory
        Parameters:
        relPath - - relative path of file/directory to be deleted from the root directory
        Throws:
        IOException - - Throws exception in case of failure

      • replaceMetaDataContents

        public void replaceMetaDataContents(File metaDataFile,
                                    File replacePath,
                                    String customStringReplacement)
        This is a convenience method that replaces placeholders in test parquet metadata files.
        Parameters:
        metaDataFile - The parquet metadata file to do string replacement on.
        replacePath - The path to replace REPLACED_IN_TEST with in the parquet metadata file.
        customStringReplacement - If this is provided a CUSTOM_STRING_REPLACEMENT is replaced in the parquet metadata file with this string.
